actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported to Senate by Senator Pell without amendment and with a preamble. With written report No. 101-213. Additional views filed.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 404.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Subjects on the Table.

official_title: A resolution expressing the support of the Senate regarding democratic reforms and human rights on Taiwan.

summary.text: Commends Taiwan on its efforts to strengthen democratic institutions. Urges: (1) the authorities on Taiwan to continue to address human rights concerns and to send a strong signal of Taiwan's continued commitment to democracy and the rule of law, a key test of which will be the elections on December 2, 1989; and (2) the Administration to convey U.S. concern over legal actions taken against Taiwanese citizens because of their political activities and statements while in the United States.

titles.title: A resolution expressing the support of the Senate regarding democratic reforms and human rights on Taiwan.
